  • City: ORLANDO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Outer packaging is a fiberboard box (overpack). Inner contents: 1 metal/steel drum in a plastic bag, dented on the bottom and loose top/cap. Unable to obtain UN Specifications for the drum. All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2025020194
item.description:
Report E-2025020194

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: PEMBROKE PINES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety, LLC (AS) to remediate the site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the impacted impacted trailer and pavement. One (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly over-pack, and all spent absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020195
item.description:
Report E-2025020195

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF A PREBUILT UNIT AAY13143UPS OFFERED TO UPS AIR CARGO SERVICES IN MIAMI, FLORIDA GOING TO COLOMBIA WE DISCOVERED ONE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED SKID INSIDE THE CONTAINER THAT CONTAINED FIVE BOXES WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. CONTENT INSPECTION OF THE LIMITED QUANTITY BOXES REVEALED KIRKLAND EXTRA STRENGTH FOR MEN MINOXIDIL TOPICAL SOLUTIONS USP, 5%. DANGEROUS GOODS ARE PROHIBITED IN ALL SHIPPER PREBUILT UNITS. AN INVESTIGATION WITH THE SHIPPER IS ONGOING.

item.title: Report X-2025020618
item.description:
Report X-2025020618

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS IN THE DMP AREA, NO VISIBLE DAMAGE OF LEAKAGE OR OPENINGS OF THE BOXES. THERE WAS A MILD ODOR IMMMITING FROM THE BOX BUT NOTHING UNCOMFORTABLE TO APPROACH. ONE PRODUCT HAS A BENT CAP THE WITH A LITTLE SOLIDIFIED MATERIAL SEALING THE BROKEN PART. SOME OF THE MATERIAL LATCH ONTO THE OTHER PRODUCTS BUT NO SIGN OF MAJOR DAMAGE OF THE BOX. THE CLEAN UP PROCESS WAS QUICK DUE TO A LACK OF LEAKGE AND WAS SEPERATED INTO THREE BAGS SINCE THERE WERE 3 DIFFERENT PRODUCTS IN ONE BOX.

item.title: Report E-2025020187
item.description:
Report E-2025020187

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: LAKE HAMILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver failed to secure the hose to drop fitting properly. Hose came loose which resulted in a diesel release of approximately 20 gallons. CDG was contacted to manage the cleanup. The contracted determined no drains were impacted. A small amount of product reached the edge of a grassy area. The asphalt was cleaned with absorbents. A small area of soil was removed.

item.title: Report E-2025020183
item.description:
Report E-2025020183

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-24
  • City: JACKSONVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver overfilled tank and failed to report. Once notified we contacted CDG to manage the cleanup. The contractor determined that the nearby drain had not been impacted. A small amount of spoil was excavated and drummed. Determined the diesel spill was estimated at 15 gallons.
